alert.note: Alert for Western Columbia River Gorge (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Ice Storm Warning issued December 25 at 12:50PM PST until December 26 at 6:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...ICE STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 6 PM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Significant icing expected. Total ice accumulations around one half inch. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...In Oregon, Western Columbia River Gorge. In Washington, Western Columbia River Gorge. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 6 PM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Travel could be difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Freezing rain is expected to transition to all rain later Monday afternoon as temperatures warm.
info.instruction: Travel is strongly discouraged. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Prepare for possible power outages. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
